intro: Fayana, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Fayana blooms in early spring, producing clusters of fragrant flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are evergreen in warmer climates.
